content.description: This climbs the arete to roof on the far right side of the Meat Alcove. Start with a few hard moves to gain a jug on the arete. Wander up the arete to the roof. Pull the roof at a surprisingly moderate grade and gain the anchors. Great rock on this one.

Scamper up a mossy slab to where the wall gets steep. Pull a 5th class move to establish yourself below the meat of the route. Make a big shouldery move out right then stay strong as you work out the correct sequence of crimps, edges and eventually a jug that will allow you to mantle up and reach the anchor.
content.location: The route starts to the right of the two steep bolted projects on the wall

content.description: Meat Sweats climbs the arete right where the trail reaches the crag, just left of the steepest wall. Start with difficulty up the steep arete. Good holds exist at the lip, but the mantle onto them might be the crux. Then negotiate a thought provoking slab to anchors on a ledge. Probably a bit soft in the grade, this felt similar in difficulty and style to Get a Grip at the other Main Cliff.
content.protection: Bolts. Stick clip the first TWO bolts. Lower offs.

content.description: This is a great route that climbs good rock on the far right side of the Meat Alcove. It's well-bolted and consequently a great choice for the beginning leader. Stick clip and start up a clean slab to a groove with a crack. Pull a slight overlap at the top and reach left to the anchors.
content.location: Right side of Meat Alcove, under Even Flow

content.description: When hiking up from below, this is the first area you come to. There's a very steep wall on the left, with a slab-to-bulge wall on the right. It's characterized by great rock, and short, powerful routes, all worth doing, especially if you have more power than endurance. Currently, the two bolted lines on the impressive short and very steep wall are closed projects.
